itemDescription: English actor in Britain and Hollywood (1883-1956)

wikipedia_page.main: Edward Cooper (28 June 1883 – 15 July 1956) was an English actor who worked extensively in both Britain and Hollywood. Cooper generally played minor or supporting parts but was occasionally given larger roles. He was married for 39 years to the actress Ethel Griffies.

* Edward Cooper (British Army officer) (1858–1945), commander of the 58th (2/1st London) Division in the First World War
Griffies married actor Walter Beaumont in 1900, and he died in 1910. In 1917, she married actor Edward Cooper,  who predeceased his wife by almost two decades.

response: *Edward Cooper in the silent film Robin Hood, Jr.(1923)

The Cost of a Kiss is a 1917 British silent drama film directed by Adrian Brunel and starring Bertram Wallis, Marjorie Day and Edward Cooper. It marked the feature film debut of Brunel who went on to become a leading British director of the 1920s. It was the only film produced by Mirror Films, a company set up by Brunel and the screenwriter H. Fowler Mear.
